Record_string.string_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

ParadymError.description:
Code is used as the error name. This name is mapped to an error title to the user.
Message is used as the error description.
Details contains a list of error details. These are rendered as a bullet list to the user.

Record_string.string-or-boolean-or-numbe.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

NonNullable_unknown_.description: Exclude null and undefined from T

Record_string.unknown_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

info.title: Paradym API Documentation
info.description:
The Paradym API allows you to programmatically issuance and verify credentials. For building credential and verification templates, you can use the template builder on [paradym.id](https://paradym.id).

You can read more information on Paradym in the [documentation](/). For usage documentation of the API endpoints, you can check out the endpoint specific documentation in this document.

## Authorization 
Authorization to the Paradym API is done using an API key, which needs to be provided in the `x-access-token` header field. To create an API key, go to the [Settings tab](https://paradym.id/app/settings/api-keys) for API keys.

get.description:
Retrieve all projects for the user associated with the API key being used for the request.

We are using the [JSON:API 1.1](https://jsonapi.org/) specification for requesting a list of entities.
From this specification we support the following query parameters:
- `filter[<property>]` - Filter the results by the given property. You can filter by multiple properties by providing multiple `filter[<property>]` query parameters. At the moment it's only possible to filter the properties in the root of the object. Also, some properties are not filterable because of performance reasons.
- `sort` - Sort the results by the given property.

We also implemented the [Cursor Pagination Profile](https://jsonapi.org/profiles/ethanresnick/cursor-pagination/) for pagination.
This means that you can use the `page[size]`, `page[before]` and `page[after]` query parameters to retrieve the next or previous page of results.
The `page[size]` parameter is used to set the number of items per page. The `page[before]` and `page[after]` parameters are used to set the cursor.
The cursor is the ID of the last item on the previous page, or the first item on the next page.

post.description:
Creates a new project under the user which is associated with the API key being used for the request.
The user will be the owner of the project.

Note that the project cannot be deleted yet so be careful with creating projects.
Also when you have multiple projects you cannot use the api endpoints anymore which doesn't have a projectId in the path.

get.description:
Retrieve all webhooks for the given project.

We are using the [JSON:API 1.1](https://jsonapi.org/) specification for requesting a list of entities.
From this specification we support the following query parameters:
- `filter[<property>]` - Filter the results by the given property. You can filter by multiple properties by providing multiple `filter[<property>]` query parameters. At the moment it's only possible to filter the properties in the root of the object. Also, some properties are not filterable because of performance reasons.
- `sort` - Sort the results by the given property.

We also implemented the [Cursor Pagination Profile](https://jsonapi.org/profiles/ethanresnick/cursor-pagination/) for pagination.
This means that you can use the `page[size]`, `page[before]` and `page[after]` query parameters to retrieve the next or previous page of results.
The `page[size]` parameter is used to set the number of items per page. The `page[before]` and `page[after]` parameters are used to set the cursor.
The cursor is the ID of the last item on the previous page, or the first item on the next page.

post.description:
Create a new webhook for the given project.

The webhook will be used to send notifications to the given URL.

The URL must be reachable from the internet. We will send a request to the given URL to verify that it's reachable.

When it's created you will get a signatureSecret. This secret is used to sign the request body. You can use this secret to verify that the request is coming from us.

For more information take a look at the [webhook documentation](https://docs.paradym.id/working-with-executions/using-webhooks).

get.description:
Retrieve all OpenId4Vc verification sessions for the project associated with the API key. You can optionally provide a
`filter[id]` in the query string to filter the results for a specific verification session.

Items are ordered by the last time they were updated descending (latest updated first).

We are using the [JSON:API 1.1](https://jsonapi.org/) specification for requesting a list of entities.
From this specification we support the following query parameters:
- `filter[<property>]` - Filter the results by the given property. You can filter by multiple properties by providing multiple `filter[<property>]` query parameters. At the moment it's only possible to filter the properties in the root of the object. Also, some properties are not filterable because of performance reasons.
- `sort` - Sort the results by the given property.

We also implemented the [Cursor Pagination Profile](https://jsonapi.org/profiles/ethanresnick/cursor-pagination/) for pagination.
This means that you can use the `page[size]`, `page[before]` and `page[after]` query parameters to retrieve the next or previous page of results.
The `page[size]` parameter is used to set the number of items per page. The `page[before]` and `page[after]` parameters are used to set the cursor.
The cursor is the ID of the last item on the previous page, or the first item on the next page.

Retrieve OpenID4VC verification session by ID.

You can only retrieve verification sessions that belongs to the project associated with the API key.

post.description:
Create a OpenID4VC verification request for the selected presentation template.

You can only create verification requests for the project associated with the API key.

See the API execution part of the [Creating a Verification Request](https://docs.paradym.id/creating-a-verification-request#api-execution) guide for more information.

get.description:
Retrieve all OpenId4Vc issuance sessions for the project associated with the API key. You can optionally provide a
`filter[id]` in the query string to filter the results for a specific issuance session.

Items are ordered by the last time they were updated descending (latest updated first).

We are using the [JSON:API 1.1](https://jsonapi.org/) specification for requesting a list of entities.
From this specification we support the following query parameters:
- `filter[<property>]` - Filter the results by the given property. You can filter by multiple properties by providing multiple `filter[<property>]` query parameters. At the moment it's only possible to filter the properties in the root of the object. Also, some properties are not filterable because of performance reasons.
- `sort` - Sort the results by the given property.

We also implemented the [Cursor Pagination Profile](https://jsonapi.org/profiles/ethanresnick/cursor-pagination/) for pagination.
This means that you can use the `page[size]`, `page[before]` and `page[after]` query parameters to retrieve the next or previous page of results.
The `page[size]` parameter is used to set the number of items per page. The `page[before]` and `page[after]` parameters are used to set the cursor.
The cursor is the ID of the last item on the previous page, or the first item on the next page.

Get a specific OpenID4VC issuance session by ID.

You can only retrieve issuance sessions that belongs to the project associated with the API key.

post.description:
Create a OpenID4VC issuance offer for the selected credentials

You can only create issuance offers for the project associated with the API key.

See the API execution part of the [Creating a Credential Offer](https://docs.paradym.id/creating-a-credential-offer#api-execution) guide for more information.

get.description: Retrieve the profile of the project this will be used for the OpenId4VC display. If there is no profile yet it will create one with the project name.

put.description: Updates the profile of the project this will be used for the OpenId4VC display.

get.description:
Retrieve all users for the project associated with the API key being used for the request.

We are using the [JSON:API 1.1](https://jsonapi.org/) specification for requesting a list of entities.
From this specification we support the following query parameters:
- `filter[<property>]` - Filter the results by the given property. You can filter by multiple properties by providing multiple `filter[<property>]` query parameters. At the moment it's only possible to filter the properties in the root of the object. Also, some properties are not filterable because of performance reasons.
- `sort` - Sort the results by the given property.

We also implemented the [Cursor Pagination Profile](https://jsonapi.org/profiles/ethanresnick/cursor-pagination/) for pagination.
This means that you can use the `page[size]`, `page[before]` and `page[after]` query parameters to retrieve the next or previous page of results.
The `page[size]` parameter is used to set the number of items per page. The `page[before]` and `page[after]` parameters are used to set the cursor.
The cursor is the ID of the last item on the previous page, or the first item on the next page.

post.description:
Add a user to the provided project by email. Beware that the user already needs to exist in the system.

**Note:** Only the owner of the project is able to add members to the project.

Remove a user from the provided project by email. Beware that the user already needs to exist in the system.

**Note:** Only the owner of the project is able to remove members from the project.

get.description:
Get all presentation templates by pagination.

We are using the [JSON:API 1.1](https://jsonapi.org/) specification for requesting a list of entities.
From this specification we support the following query parameters:
- `filter[<property>]` - Filter the results by the given property. You can filter by multiple properties by providing multiple `filter[<property>]` query parameters. At the moment it's only possible to filter the properties in the root of the object. Also, some properties are not filterable because of performance reasons.
- `sort` - Sort the results by the given property.

We also implemented the [Cursor Pagination Profile](https://jsonapi.org/profiles/ethanresnick/cursor-pagination/) for pagination.
This means that you can use the `page[size]`, `page[before]` and `page[after]` query parameters to retrieve the next or previous page of results.
The `page[size]` parameter is used to set the number of items per page. The `page[before]` and `page[after]` parameters are used to set the cursor.
The cursor is the ID of the last item on the previous page, or the first item on the next page.

put.description:
Update a specific presentation template.

This will replace the entire template with the new one.

post.description: Create a new SD-JWT VC template.

put.description:
Update a specific SD-JWT VC template.

This will replace the entire template with the new one.

get.description: Get a specific SD-JWT VC template.

delete.description: Delete a specific SD-JWT VC template.

get.description:
Get the JSON schema for a SD-JWT VC template.

Which you could use to generate forms or validate the input.
get.summary: Retrieve JSON schema for sd-jwt-vc credential template
